movie_title: The Flying Dutchman: A Complete History - Mythillogical Podcast
introduction: On our second ever solo episode, Charles takes a deep dive into the briny seas of the 18th century,

vocabulary.example: The sailors claimed to have seen a phantom ship with a ghostly crew sailing in the air.

vocabulary.definition: giving the impression that something bad or unpleasant is going to happen
vocabulary.example: The appearance of the Flying Dutchman was considered an ominous sign to the sailors.

vocabulary.definition: under a spell or evil influence; deserving of a curse
vocabulary.example: The ship was believed to be cursed due to its history as a slave ship.

vocabulary.definition: an optical illusion caused by atmospheric conditions, making objects appear displaced from their true positions
vocabulary.example: The sailors mistook the mirage of a ship sailing in the air for the legendary Flying Dutchman.

vocabulary.definition: regain possession of something lost or taken away
vocabulary.example: The captain tried to recapture the letters lost in the wind after the ship gave a great lurch.

vocabulary.definition: to retrieve or recover something perceived as lost or taken away
vocabulary.example: The Dutch country reclaimed the legend of the Flying Dutchman, adapting it to fit their own narrative.
